q: The more you are grateful for what you have the more you will have to be grateful for.
h:
“The more you are grateful for what you have the more you will have to be grateful for. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our mind.
h:
“Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our mind.” —
Bob Marley

q: Better the cottage where one is merry than the palace where one weeps.
h:
“Better the cottage where one is merry than the palace where one weeps.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: The face is the mirror of the mind, and eyes without speaking confess the secrets of the heart.
h:
“The face is the mirror of the mind, and eyes without speaking confess the secrets of the heart. ” —
St. Jerome

q: Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor.
h:
“Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: You are not what you think you are, You are not what others think you are, You are what you think others think you are.
h:
“You are not what you think you are, You are not what others think you are, You are what you think others think you are.” —
Unknown

q: Your very silence shows you agree.
h:
“Your very silence shows you agree.” —
Euripides

q: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
h:
“Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Where words fail, music speaks.
h:
“Where words fail, music speaks.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality.
h:
“Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: It is not titles that honour men, but men that honour titles.
h:
“It is not titles that honour men, but men that honour titles.” —
Niccolo Machiavelli

q: Things do not have meaning. We assign meaning to everything.
h:
“Things do not have meaning. We assign meaning to everything.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Invisible things are the only realities.
h:
“Invisible things are the only realities.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
h:
“Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack. ” —
Seneca

q: Every day may not be good, but there's something good in every day.
h:
“Every day may not be good, but there's something good in every day.” —
Unknown

q: Bad things are not the worst things that an happen to us. NOTHING is the worst thing that can happen to us.
h:
“Bad things are not the worst things that an happen to us. NOTHING is the worst thing that can happen to us.” —
Richard Bach

q: People don't care how much you know until they know how much you care.
h:
“People don't care how much you know until they know how much you care.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: If I cannot do great things. I can do small things in a great way.
h:
“If I cannot do great things. I can do small things in a great way.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.
h:
“Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Be the change that you want to see in the world.
h:
“Be the change that you want to see in the world.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: It doesn't matter where you are, you are nowhere compared to where you can go.
h:
“It doesn't matter where you are, you are nowhere compared to where you can go.” —
Bob Proctor

q: Make peace with your inner turmoil.
h:
“Make peace with your inner turmoil.” —
Unknown

q: None of us can change our yesterdays but all of us can change our tomorrows.
h:
“None of us can change our yesterdays but all of us can change our tomorrows.” —
Colin Powell

q: Not all those who wander are lost.
h:
“Not all those who wander are lost.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: The future belongs to those who learn more skills and combine them in creative ways.
h:
“The future belongs to those who learn more skills and combine them in creative ways.” —
Robert Greene

q: Ancient Rule of Twenty-one: if you do anything for twenty-one days in a row, it will be installed as a habit.
h:
“Ancient Rule of Twenty-one: if you do anything for twenty-one days in a row, it will be installed as a habit.” —
Robin Sharma

q: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
h:
“You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Be strong. Be confident. Be the star of your own life.
h:
“Be strong. Be confident. Be the star of your own life.” —
Estee Lauder

q: Unhappiness enters through a door that has been left open.
h:
“Unhappiness enters through a door that has been left open.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Forget mistakes. Forget failure. Forget everything except what you are going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day!
h:
“Forget mistakes. Forget failure. Forget everything except what you are going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day!” —
Og Mandino

q: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
h:
“In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.” —
Carl Jung

q: Sometimes you will never know the value of something, until it becomes a memory.
h:
“Sometimes you will never know the value of something, until it becomes a memory.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: Remember the entrance to the sanctuary is inside you.
h:
“Remember the entrance to the sanctuary is inside you.” —
Rumi

q: Believe you can and you will be halfway there.
h:
“Believe you can and you will be halfway there.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: The less you talk about your shame, the more of it you have.
h:
“The less you talk about your shame, the more of it you have.” —
Mark Manson

q: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
h:
“The friendship that can cease has never been real. ” —
St. Jerome

q: Dream big and dare to fail.
h:
“Dream big and dare to fail.” —
Norman Vaughan

q: Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.
h:
“Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
h:
“Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Fear of death is fear of the Unknown.
h:
“Fear of death is fear of the Unknown.” —
Adi Da Samraj

q: I'm an optimist by choice not by stupidity.
h:
“I'm an optimist by choice not by stupidity.” —
Yanni

q: If you don't program yourself, life will program you.
h:
“If you don't program yourself, life will program you.” —
Les Brown

q: Good things aren't supposed to just fall into your lap.
h:
“Good things aren't supposed to just fall into your lap.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: To succeed takes more than the desire to win. It also takes the acceptance that we could fail.
h:
“To succeed takes more than the desire to win. It also takes the acceptance that we could fail.” —
Simon Sinek

q: Hope is a waking dream.
h:
“Hope is a waking dream.” —
Aristotle

q: I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy.
h:
“I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy.” —
Richard Bach

q: It is safer to search in the maze than to remain in a cheeseless situation.
h:
“It is safer to search in the maze than to remain in a cheeseless situation.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Don't concern yourself with the money. Be of service. Build. Work. Dream. Create.
h:
“Don't concern yourself with the money. Be of service. Build. Work. Dream. Create.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Each time we don't say what we wanna say, we're dying.
h:
“Each time we don't say what we wanna say, we're dying.” —
Yoko Ono

q: No matter how smart we may think we are, no matter how committed we are to our truth, we can lose our way.
h:
“No matter how smart we may think we are, no matter how committed we are to our truth, we can lose our way.” —
Kamal Ravikant
